content: quote: Originally posted by soscorpio: quote: It is not -illegal- for AF 1 to fly over New York. It's illegal to yell "FIRE" in a movie theater......won't the two have similar effects? Whether illegal or not, it was a stupid decision. The FAA admitted it could cause a panic but approved it anyway. If the stated reason is true, they wanted to get a photo shot of Air Force 1 flying by the Statue of Liberty, why not "photoshop it". Easier, cheaper and a good graphic designer could make it so realistic it would take a lab to tell the difference. Stupid decision.
quote: Originally posted by soscorpio: quote: It is not -illegal- for AF 1 to fly over New York. It's illegal to yell "FIRE" in a movie theater......won't the two have similar effects?

title: FAA Memo: Feds Knew NYC Flyover Would Cause Panic

content: quote: One of his political guys would have said, "Whoa, hold it." He ordered a probe and apologized. "http://wcbstv.com/topstories/air.force.one.2.996457.html" The Office of Military Affairs is headed by Louis Caldera ... and Obama political appointee.

title: FAA Memo: Feds Knew NYC Flyover Would Cause Panic

content: quote: Originally posted by soscorpio: quote: It is not -illegal- for AF 1 to fly over New York. It's illegal to yell "FIRE" in a movie theater......won't the two have similar effects? Whether illegal or not, it was a stupid decision. The FAA admitted it could cause a panic but approved it anyway. If the stated reason is true, they wanted to get a photo shot of Air Force 1 flying by the Statue of Liberty, why not "photoshop it". Easier, cheaper and a good graphic designer could make it so realistic it would take a lab to tell the difference. Stupid decision.
